page.title: 04A CONTRACT FARMER (CONT.)
page.content: THE GRASS_CUTTERS ARE USED MOST REGULARLY BUT THE BEET HARVESTERS WEAR OUT MOST QUICKLY BECAUSE THEY HAVE THE TOUGHEST JOB AND SO THEY ARE THE MACHINES WHICH NEED REPLACING MOST OFTEN. Mr. ASQUITH TENDS TO BUY BRITISH MACHINERY. THE CROPS Mr. ASQUITH HARVESTS ARE SUGAR BEET, BARLEY, WHEAT, OATS AND RAPE. Mr. ASQUITH HAS THE MACHINERY TO DEAL WITH MOST LOCAL CROPS EXCEPT POTATOES AND PEAS. HIS FAVOURITE JOB IS SUGAR BEET DRILLING BECAUSE HE FINDS IT VERY INTERESTING. HE THINKS SUGAR BEET HARVESTING IS THE WORST JOB BECAUSE OF BAD CONDITIONS. HE WORKS FOR 50 OR 60 LOCAL FARMERS AND ALSO SPENDS MANY HOURS REPAIRING HIS MACHINERY. HE WORKS BETWEEN 8 AND 16 HOURS A DAY DEPENDING ON THE SEASONS.
